Technique: FORMED BY HAND; PAINTED; ENGRAVED; FAYENCE; ENGRAVED; WRITTEN WITH A REED PEN/REED WITH SPLIT NIB
Name: Shabti of king Aspelta
Description: This funerary statuette comes from the pyramid of king Aspelta at Nuri. It is distinguished by its more round and  developped build than that of another figurine of the same king preserved in the Museum of Brussels (E.6107A). The shabti holds a hoe and a pick in the hands. The hieroglyphic text engraved in eight horizontal lines contains Chapter 6 from the Book of the Dead.
